creator: noelgrandin@gmail.com
text:
Using the following buildfile:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project basedir="." default="createMergedJar" name="test">
  <target depends="" name="createMergedJar">
    <zip destfile="proguard_input.jar" duplicate="preserve">
      <zipgroupfileset file="timeutilities.jar" />
    </zip>
  </target>	
</project>

where the inner jar file is actually called TimeUtilities.jar will simply result in TimeUtilities.jar file being skipped, with no warning.

creator: noelgrandin@gmail.com
text: But it all works fine if I get the case of the filename correct.

that's what the casesensitive attribute is for 8-)

<zipgroupfileset file="timeutilities.jar" casesensitive="false"/>

should work.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
Aaaaargh.
This is what I get for developing on Windows.

Surely 

(1) this should be documented somewhere?
   I can find exactly one line of text in the current manual
   about zipgroupfileset, and it doesn't document any of it's attributes.

(2) There should be some way of saying 
    "it's an error if this file doesn't exist"??

Thanks.
creator: noelgrandin@gmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
(1) should be addressed with svn revision 807533

(2) is a duplicate of bug #32526
